flavor: With each passing day alone, Hoshiko found it harder to think. With each hour, the static grew louder.
printed_text:
As an additional cost to play this event, trash an installed resource.
Gain 7[credit].
stripped_printed_text: As an additional cost to play this event, trash an installed resource. Gain 7 credits.

flavor:
Step 1: Apply to Problem.
Step 2: No more Problem!
printed_text: +1[mu] The trash cost of each Corp card is lowered by 1. The first time each turn you trash a Corp card, gain 1[credit]. Limit 1 console per player.
stripped_printed_text: +1 mu The trash cost of each Corp card is lowered by 1. The first time each turn you trash a Corp card, gain 1 credit. Limit 1 console per player.

flavor: *tap* *tap* *tap*
printed_text:
Install only on a piece of ice.
Host ice gets -1 strength for each hosted virus counter.
When you encounter host ice, if its strength is 0 or less, trash it. Otherwise, place 1 virus counter on this program.
stripped_printed_text: Install only on a piece of ice. Host ice gets -1 strength for each hosted virus counter. When you encounter host ice, if its strength is 0 or less, trash it. Otherwise, place 1 virus counter on this program.

flavor: "Net space is an abstraction, a white lie protecting fragile comprehensions. Do not limit yourself." -z\h/r
printed_text: [click]: Run R&D. If successful, instead of breaching R&D, reveal the top 3 cards of R&D. Trash 1 of the revealed cards. Use this ability only once per turn.
stripped_printed_text: click: Run R&D. If successful, instead of breaching R&D, reveal the top 3 cards of R&D. Trash 1 of the revealed cards. Use this ability only once per turn.

flavor: Sing, sing as your heart desires!
printed_text: Interface → X[credit]: Break X code gate subroutines. Use this ability only once per run. Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 code gate subroutine. Use this ability only if you have 3 or more installed virtual resources. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
stripped_printed_text: Interface -> X credits: Break X code gate subroutines. Use this ability only once per run. Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 code gate subroutine. Use this ability only if you have 3 or more installed virtual resources. 1 credit: +1 strength.

printed_text: When your turn begins, remove this resource from the game. Choose a server protected by ice. The Corp may trash 1 piece of ice protecting that server. If they do not, the first time this turn you breach either R&D or HQ, access 2 additional cards.
stripped_printed_text: When your turn begins, remove this resource from the game. Choose a server protected by ice. The Corp may trash 1 piece of ice protecting that server. If they do not, the first time this turn you breach either R&D or HQ, access 2 additional cards.

flavor: Friends break your walls.
printed_text:
When your turn begins or you steal an agenda, place 1[credit] on this resource.
Whenever you make a successful run, you may spend hosted credits for the remainder of that run.
When your turn ends, if there are 3 or more hosted credits, you must pay 1[credit] or trash this resource.
stripped_printed_text: When your turn begins or you steal an agenda, place 1 credit on this resource. Whenever you make a successful run, you may spend hosted credits for the remainder of that run. When your turn ends, if there are 3 or more hosted credits, you must pay 1 credit or trash this resource.

flavor: "...well, I'm laughing."
printed_text: The first time each turn you install a virus program, place 2 virus counters on this resource. When your turn begins, you may remove any 2 virus counters from your installed cards. If you do, draw 2 cards unless the Corp trashes the top card of R&D.
stripped_printed_text: The first time each turn you install a virus program, place 2 virus counters on this resource. When your turn begins, you may remove any 2 virus counters from your installed cards. If you do, draw 2 cards unless the Corp trashes the top card of R&D.

flavor: Friends hide your fears.
printed_text:
When your turn begins or you steal an agenda, place 1[credit] on this resource.
Spend hosted credits to use programs during runs.
When your turn ends, if there are 3 or more hosted credits, you must take 1 tag or trash this resource.
stripped_printed_text: When your turn begins or you steal an agenda, place 1 credit on this resource. Spend hosted credits to use programs during runs. When your turn ends, if there are 3 or more hosted credits, you must take 1 tag or trash this resource.

flavor: "You're not listening."
printed_text: The first job resource, connection resource, or piece of hardware you install each turn costs 1[credit] less to install.
stripped_printed_text: The first job resource, connection resource, or piece of hardware you install each turn costs 1 credit less to install.

flavor:
"Everyone told me she was reliable in a pinch."
 -Az McCaffrey
printed_text: Run any server. When that run ends, if it was unsuccessful, you may run that server again, ignoring any additional costs to run. During the second run, when you encounter the last ice you encountered in the first run, bypass it.
stripped_printed_text: Run any server. When that run ends, if it was unsuccessful, you may run that server again, ignoring any additional costs to run. During the second run, when you encounter the last ice you encountered in the first run, bypass it.

flavor: Blue flames burn the hottest!
printed_text: Look at the top 2 cards of your stack. You may add 1 of those cards to the bottom of your stack. Draw 2 cards.
stripped_printed_text: Look at the top 2 cards of your stack. You may add 1 of those cards to the bottom of your stack. Draw 2 cards.

flavor: BMI switches let runners surface without a true disconnect. Handy for a break... immediately.
printed_text:
You cannot use this hardware during the Corp's turn.
[trash]: Jack out.
[trash]: Remove 1 tag.
[interrupt] → [trash]: Reduce the base trace strength of a trace to 0.
stripped_printed_text: You cannot use this hardware during the Corp's turn. trash: Jack out. trash: Remove 1 tag. Interrupt -> trash: Reduce the base trace strength of a trace to 0.

flavor: Want to win a coinflip? Use a coin with two heads.
printed_text: Remove this hardware from the game: Prevent a Corp card ability from ending the run. Use this ability only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
stripped_printed_text: Remove this hardware from the game: Prevent a Corp card ability from ending the run. Use this ability only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.

flavor:
v35: Springs to the mount ejectors (new feature)
v36: Reduced power to springs (x5)
printed_text: +1[mu]. The first time each turn you install a piece of hardware, draw 1 card. Whenever a run begins, you may install a piece of hardware, paying 1[credit] more. Limit 1 console per player.
stripped_printed_text: +1 mu. The first time each turn you install a piece of hardware, draw 1 card. Whenever a run begins, you may install a piece of hardware, paying 1 credit more. Limit 1 console per player.

flavor: "Do the job. Get paid. Leave feelings at the door." -"Baklan" Bochkin
printed_text: Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 sentry subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength. The first time each turn this program fully breaks a piece of ice, gain 2[credit].
stripped_printed_text: Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 sentry subroutine. 1 credit: +1 strength. The first time each turn this program fully breaks a piece of ice, gain 2 credits.

flavor: "Psh, let them gossip. The cat knows whose meat it has eaten." -"Baklan" Bochkin
printed_text:
The first time each run you encounter a piece of ice, place 1 power counter on this resource.
[trash]: Derez the ice you are encountering if its strength is equal to or less than the number of hosted power counters. Take 1 tag.
stripped_printed_text: The first time each run you encounter a piece of ice, place 1 power counter on this resource. trash: Derez the ice you are encountering if its strength is equal to or less than the number of hosted power counters. Take 1 tag.

flavor: "...but I am without compare."
printed_text:
When your discard phase ends, if you installed this resource this turn, draw 4 cards.
[interrupt] → The first time each turn you would draw any number of cards, look at the top X cards of your stack. Add 1 of those cards to the bottom of your stack. X is equal to the number of cards you will draw plus 1.
stripped_printed_text: When your discard phase ends, if you installed this resource this turn, draw 4 cards. Interrupt -> The first time each turn you would draw any number of cards, look at the top X cards of your stack. Add 1 of those cards to the bottom of your stack. X is equal to the number of cards you will draw plus 1.

printed_text: When your turn ends, if you have the same number of cards in your grip as the Corp has in HQ, you may draw 1 card.
stripped_printed_text: When your turn ends, if you have the same number of cards in your grip as the Corp has in HQ, you may draw 1 card.

flavor: Do you know how many food deliveries I've missed this week?
printed_text:
Play only as your first [click].
Whenever you install a card with a printed install cost of 1 or greater this turn, draw 1 card or gain 1[credit].
stripped_printed_text: Play only as your first click. Whenever you install a card with a printed install cost of 1 or greater this turn, draw 1 card or gain 1 credit.

printed_text: Run R&D. If successful, instead of breaching R&D, choose a number greater than 0. For each installed card you have with a printed install cost matching that number, reveal 1 card from the top of R&D (max 6). Access 1 of the revealed cards, then the Corp shuffles R&D.
stripped_printed_text: Run R&D. If successful, instead of breaching R&D, choose a number greater than 0. For each installed card you have with a printed install cost matching that number, reveal 1 card from the top of R&D (max 6). Access 1 of the revealed cards, then the Corp shuffles R&D.

flavor:
"There is never a wasted program. Someone, somewhere, will have a use for that code. Even corps are scrambling for quick fixes nowadays."
-Lat
printed_text:
As an additional cost to play this event, trash an installed program.
Gain 4[credit] and draw 2 cards.
stripped_printed_text: As an additional cost to play this event, trash an installed program. Gain 4 credits and draw 2 cards.

flavor: The Net is boundless, but the right access port is worth a road trip.
printed_text: +2[mu] You have +1 maximum hand size. When your turn ends, if you and the Corp have the same number of credits, you may gain 2[credit]. Limit 1 console per player.
stripped_printed_text: +2 mu You have +1 maximum hand size. When your turn ends, if you and the Corp have the same number of credits, you may gain 2 credits. Limit 1 console per player.

flavor: It is not knowledge, but the act of learning, not possession, but the act of getting there, which grants the greatest enjoyment.
printed_text: When you install this program, it gets +3 strength for the remainder of the turn. Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 barrier subroutine. 2[credit]: +2 strength.
stripped_printed_text: When you install this program, it gets +3 strength for the remainder of the turn. Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 barrier subroutine. 2 credits: +2 strength.

flavor: It makes sysops see red. And orange, yellow, green...
printed_text: When you install this program, place 2 virus counters on it. Hosted virus counter: Choose an ice subtype. The ice you are encountering gains that subtype for the remainder of the encounter. Use this ability only once per turn.
stripped_printed_text: When you install this program, place 2 virus counters on it. Hosted virus counter: Choose an ice subtype. The ice you are encountering gains that subtype for the remainder of the encounter. Use this ability only once per turn.

flavor: "It takes such simple things to sustain us, the most important of which is to be thankful." -Lat
printed_text: When your turn begins, gain 1[credit].
stripped_printed_text: When your turn begins, gain 1 credit.

flavor: "...then let me paint you a picture."
printed_text:
Use each ability on this resource only once per turn.
[click]: Gain 2[credit].
[click]: Install a program or piece of hardware, paying 1[credit] less.
stripped_printed_text: Use each ability on this resource only once per turn. click: Gain 2 credits. click: Install a program or piece of hardware, paying 1 credit less.

flavor: Get into the ducts on the roof and keep crawling till you hit that old network root. Dirty work, I know, but it beats playing by the rules.
printed_text:
While you are resolving this event, each player's identity loses all abilities.
Run any server. When that run ends, you may shuffle this event into your stack.
stripped_printed_text: While you are resolving this event, each player's identity loses all abilities. Run any server. When that run ends, you may shuffle this event into your stack.

flavor: I didn't say your hopper should be hauling garbage. I said it should be hauled away as garbage.
printed_text: Add an installed program or piece of hardware to your grip. If you do, you may install a program or piece of hardware, paying X[credit] less. X is equal to the printed install cost of the uninstalled card.
stripped_printed_text: Add an installed program or piece of hardware to your grip. If you do, you may install a program or piece of hardware, paying X credits less. X is equal to the printed install cost of the uninstalled card.

flavor: "Corporations are made of people; just normal people doing their 6-to-6. The right truths, the right critique, and they can be redeemed." -Lat
printed_text: Whenever you make a successful run, you may trash this resource to name an agenda. The next time this run you access a copy of the named agenda, steal it, ignoring all costs. (You are no longer accessing it.)
stripped_printed_text: Whenever you make a successful run, you may trash this resource to name an agenda. The next time this run you access a copy of the named agenda, steal it, ignoring all costs. (You are no longer accessing it.)

printed_text: If the first, second, and third actions you take on your turn are different from each other, when the third completes, you may gain 1[credit] or take another different action, paying 1[click] less.
stripped_printed_text: If the first, second, and third actions you take on your turn are different from each other, when the third completes, you may gain 1 credit or take another different action, paying 1click less.

flavor:
"Early success should be rewarded, as it will encourage a culture of drive and competition."
-Corporate Leadership for Dummies
printed_text: When you score this agenda, look at the top 5 cards of R&D. You may install and rez 1 of those cards, ignoring all costs.
stripped_printed_text: When you score this agenda, look at the top 5 cards of R&D. You may install and rez 1 of those cards, ignoring all costs.

flavor: Unit is holding .78 asimovs of stress potential in all three directive logic traps. Psychiatric session mandated during next maintenance cycle.
printed_text:
[click]: Draw 2 cards. Use this ability only once per turn.
When the Runner trashes this asset, you may draw 2 cards.
stripped_printed_text: click: Draw 2 cards. Use this ability only once per turn. When the Runner trashes this asset, you may draw 2 cards.

flavor: At the scale where nanobots cut glass, quantum mechanics dictate error. A silicon atom here, an oxygen there, an erbium out of place. Each bioroid is born unique.
printed_text:
[click]: Gain 2[credit]. Use this ability only once per turn.
When the Runner trashes this asset, you may gain 2[credit].
stripped_printed_text: click: Gain 2 credits. Use this ability only once per turn. When the Runner trashes this asset, you may gain 2 credits.

flavor: Old warriors have seen all the tricks; be forthright or fail.
printed_text: This ice has -1 strength for each installed icebreaker. [subroutine] Trash 1 program that is not a decoder, fracter, or killer. [subroutine] End the run.
stripped_printed_text: This ice has -1 strength for each installed icebreaker. Subroutine Trash 1 program that is not a decoder, fracter, or killer. Subroutine End the run.

flavor: Haas' unsecured servers were fortified just before the storm. Are their bioroid oracles that good, or were they tipped off?
printed_text: Gain 2[credit] or draw 2 cards. Repeat this process for each remote server that has a card in its root and is protected by ice.
stripped_printed_text: Gain 2 credits or draw 2 cards. Repeat this process for each remote server that has a card in its root and is protected by ice.

flavor: Not all secrets lie in vaults.

Resolve two of the following in any order:
  • Draw 2 cards.
  • Gain 2[credit].
  • Install up to 1 non-agenda card.
  • Gain [click].
stripped_printed_text: Resolve two of the following in any order: * Draw 2 cards. * Gain 2 credits. * Install up to 1 non-agenda card. * Gain click.

flavor: The Net abhors a vacuum. Any unexplained gap must be made.
printed_text:
[click]: Place 1 power counter on this upgrade.
As an additional cost to run this server, the Runner must spend 1[click] and 1[credit] for each hosted power counter.
When your turn begins, remove all hosted power counters.
stripped_printed_text: click: Place 1 power counter on this upgrade. As an additional cost to run this server, the Runner must spend 1click and 1 credit for each hosted power counter. When your turn begins, remove all hosted power counters.

flavor: No Stone Unturned.

The first time each turn you reveal a card, gain 1[credit].
[click]: Reveal a card from the grip at random or the top card of the stack.
stripped_printed_text: The first time each turn you reveal a card, gain 1 credit. click: Reveal a card from the grip at random or the top card of the stack.

printed_text: When you score this agenda, place 1 agenda counter on it for each hosted advancement counter past 3. Hosted agenda counter: Swap 1 card from HQ with 1 card in the root of or protecting the attacked server. The Runner may jack out. Use this ability only during a run.
stripped_printed_text: When you score this agenda, place 1 agenda counter on it for each hosted advancement counter past 3. Hosted agenda counter: Swap 1 card from HQ with 1 card in the root of or protecting the attacked server. The Runner may jack out. Use this ability only during a run.

flavor:
"'It is my nature,' said the scorpion."
-Conceptual Frameworks in Bio-Ethics and Synthetic Morality, Moser University Press

stripped_printed_text: When a player scores or steals this agenda, do X net damage. X is equal to the number of copies of Sting! in the other player's score area plus 1.

flavor: Hyoubu is our vanguard in the battle for hearts and minds.
printed_text: When your turn begins, reveal the top card of R&D and gain 2[credit].
stripped_printed_text: When your turn begins, reveal the top card of R&D and gain 2 credits.

flavor: "Memory is a tangle of emotional threads. Pull one, it twists a second, unravels a third!" -Letheia Nisei

stripped_printed_text: The first time each turn you trash (from any location) a card that matches the faction of the Runner's identity, place 1 power counter on this asset. click, hosted power counter: Do 1 net damage.

printed_text:
When the Runner encounters this ice, choose a card type. For the remainder of the encounter, whenever you trash a card of that type with net damage from a subroutine on this ice, do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.

printed_text:
After you resolve this operation, your action phase ends.
Play only if the Runner has 3 or more agenda points and they made a successful run during their last turn.
Name a card, then do 1 net damage. If you trash a copy of the named card, repeat this process.
stripped_printed_text: After you resolve this operation, your action phase ends. Play only if the Runner has 3 or more agenda points and they made a successful run during their last turn. Name a card, then do 1 net damage. If you trash a copy of the named card, repeat this process.

printed_text: The first time each run the Runner approaches this server, you and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, you may trash this upgrade. If you do, the Runner moves to the outermost position of this server. The Runner may jack out.
stripped_printed_text: The first time each run the Runner approaches this server, you and the Runner secretly spend 0 credits, 1 credit, or 2 credits. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, you may trash this upgrade. If you do, the Runner moves to the outermost position of this server. The Runner may jack out.

flavor:
Scrub-loving devs nerfed cannon rushes cause whiny bronzers complained. Left me four wins down in finals.
Anyway I won.
printed_text: When you score this agenda, place 1 agenda counter on it. Hosted agenda counter: Place 1 advancement token on an installed card.
stripped_printed_text: When you score this agenda, place 1 agenda counter on it. Hosted agenda counter: Place 1 advancement token on an installed card.

printed_text:
Rez only during your action phase.
Whenever the Runner makes a successful run on this server, they gain 2[credit].
When your turn begins, gain 3[credit] if the Runner did not make any successful runs on this server during their last turn.
stripped_printed_text: Rez only during your action phase. Whenever the Runner makes a successful run on this server, they gain 2 credits. When your turn begins, gain 3 credits if the Runner did not make any successful runs on this server during their last turn.

flavor: Subscribe for 12 months to get that premium uplink you need to blaze ahead of the crowd!
printed_text: The first time each turn a run begins, gain 1[credit].
stripped_printed_text: The first time each turn a run begins, gain 1 credit.

flavor: You are the ONE BILLIONTH visitor!

When the Runner passes this ice, gain 1[credit].
[subroutine]Gain 2[credit]. The Runner gains 1[credit].
stripped_printed_text: When the Runner passes this ice, gain 1 credit. Subroutine Gain 2 credits. The Runner gains 1 credit.

flavor: Though many countries attempted to regulate digital loot boxes in the early 21st century, GameNET has managed to circumvent any such laws via explicit, transparent percentage rates... and some very determined lobbyists.
printed_text:
[subroutine]End the run unless the Runner pays 2[credit].
[subroutine]Reveal the top 3 cards of the stack. Add 1 of those cards to the grip and gain credits equal to its install or play cost. The Runner shuffles the stack. Trash this ice.

flavor: "There's gonna be catering, right?"
printed_text:
Play only if the Runner made a successful run during their last turn.
Choose a card type, then reveal the grip. You may pay X[credit] to place X advancement tokens on an installed card. X is equal to or less than the number of revealed cards of the chosen type.
stripped_printed_text: Play only if the Runner made a successful run during their last turn. Choose a card type, then reveal the grip. You may pay X credits to place X advancement tokens on an installed card. X is equal to or less than the number of revealed cards of the chosen type.

flavor: It is pitch black. You are likely to be eaten by a Troll.
printed_text: Play only if the Runner stole an agenda during their last turn. Choose a Runner card type. Trash all installed non-icebreaker cards of that type. The Runner may prevent any of those cards from being trashed by paying 3[credit] each. Take 1 bad publicity.

flavor: Ultra-Mythic chance ↑!↑!↑! Free Vorpal Tommy Gun [epic] and pinstripe suit [cosmetic] with 10x buy-in!

While the Runner is accessing this upgrade in R&D, they must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses this upgrade, remove 1 bad publicity unless they take 1 tag.
stripped_printed_text: While the Runner is accessing this upgrade in R&D, they must reveal it. When the Runner accesses this upgrade, remove 1 bad publicity unless they take 1 tag.

flavor: As the documents show, for eight months they have operated as an entirely independent fiscal entity. We are as appalled at the carelessness as you are, and fully support City Hall's investigation.

stripped_printed_text: Whenever the Runner steals another agenda, you may forfeit this agenda to gain 5 credits and add the stolen agenda to HQ.

-The SecTech Mantra

flavor: The Fracture was no different from any other crisis. As always, Management's first instinct was to find someone to blame. Getting food up to Midway or He3 down to power Earthside hospitals are trivialities compared to the important work of salving Executive ego and keeping one's job.
printed_text: You cannot score this agenda if you installed it this turn.

flavor:
"By matching funds on your donations, the Space Elevator Authority has already planted over eight million trees on the Pacific coast. Together we can restore New Angeles to its former glory."
-Elizabeth Mills
